controller

Class PMControllerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.PMControllerTest

  • public class PMControllerTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to test the PMController (non-trivial methods only).
    Author:
    sopr010

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PMControllerTest()

    • Constructor Detail

      • PMControllerTest

        public PMControllerTest()

    • Method Detail

      • createRandomPassword

        public static byte[] createRandomPassword(int length)
        Auxiliary method to create a random password with fixed length.
        Parameters:
        length - Length of the returned password
        Returns:
        randomly generated password

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets up the Test object before each test run. Therefore creates a new PMController instance to be tested and a random preset password. The used PasswordManager instance is saved in the attribute "mockPasswordManager".
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - May throw a NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • runTestsForSetMasterPassword

        public void runTestsForSetMasterPassword()
        Tests whether PMController.setMasterPassword(String) works correctly and throws proper exceptions on invalid input. The correct encryption is tested in testSetMasterPasswordRandom(); this test is executed NUMBER_ITERATIONS times.

      • testSetMasterPasswordRandom

        public void testSetMasterPasswordRandom()
        Calls PMController.setMasterPassword(String) with a randomly generated key. Afterwards tests if the secret key set in the PasswordManager was derived correctly. Fails if this is not the case, thus doesn't need to return anything.

      • runTestsForValidateMasterPassword

        public void runTestsForValidateMasterPassword()
        Tests whether PMController.validateMasterPassword(String) works correctly and throws proper exceptions on invalid input. The correct accepting/declining is tested in testValidateMasterPasswordRandom() with random passwords; this test is executed NUMBER_ITERATIONS times.

      • testValidateMasterPasswordRandom

        public void testValidateMasterPasswordRandom()
        Calls PMController.validateMasterPassword(java.lang.String) with a randomly generated password. Fails if two equal passwords are declined or two different ones are accepted.
